#summary GnarWall definition and history

= Definition =

A GnarWall is any firewall or related system built using the GnarWall project's code and/or tutorials.


= History =

GnarWall is a continuation of the [http://staff.washington.edu/corey/fw/ NDC LFW] project led by Corey Satten at the [http://www.washington.edu/ University of Washington].  Corey developed CGI scripts to produce firewall rules and configuration files for Linux systems.  The [http://www.gibraltar.at/ Gibraltar] live CD, based on [http://www.debian.org/ Debian] [http://www.gnu.org/ GNU]/[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linux Linux], was the primary platform.
